content: oopppsss...my bad it was an E-7 It was actually a situation that happened to my husband this morning. According to what my husband said he had plenty of room to get over and this guy got ****ed at him. The guy gave him a dirty look and followed him to the parking lot asked him where he worked but wouldn't tell my husband what rank he was or where he worked. and he was in civilian clothes so he didn't have his uniform on. It does sound like a power trip but my husband wants to find written proof that they can't do this to him and I'm trying to find out where I can get documention of how and when you can get written up

content: quote: I believe a E-7 can write up a E-less anytime anywhere. My advice, take your little chit and move on. Shockey I would concur with that. If I'm the next up the CofC I would call both parties in and see if it could be handled as a verbal warning. Think of it this way, if the chief saw it and did nothing and the E6 was involved in a serious accident shortly there after, would the chief be seen as negligent? You tell me. A listening ear, a caring heart, an open mind and an extend hand may be all I can offer, but they are yours without charge or judgment.
quote: I believe a E-7 can write up a E-less anytime anywhere. My advice, take your little chit and move on. Shockey

A listening ear, a caring heart, an open mind and an extend hand may be all I can offer, but they are yours without charge or judgment.

content: it's a counseling chit. i had a collection of those while i was in. laughed about them. ESPECIALLY the one i got from a warrent officer (hope he sees this ) who wrote me up for being anti social. he was upset because everytime he asked me how i was doing, i said "just fine, sir" seems he didn't like it that i didn't tell him anything about my personal life. i asked him why it was any of his buisness. he said he was upset because he didn't know anything about me, what i did in my off time, etc. i told him, that with all due respect, as long as i wasn't arrested, etc my personal life, was just that personal. and then i got the chit. blow it off. 3 sides to every story. years from you won't remember or care.
reply: it's a counseling chit. i had a collection of those while i was in. laughed about them. content: it's a counseling chit. i had a collection of those while i was in. laughed about them. ESPECIALLY the one i got from a warrent officer (hope he sees this ) who wrote me up for being anti social. he was upset because everytime he asked me how i was doing, i said "just fine, sir" seems he didn't like it that i didn't tell him anything about my personal life. i asked him why it was any of his buisness. he said he was upset because he didn't know anything about me, what i did in my off time, etc. i told him, that with all due respect, as long as i wasn't arrested, etc my personal life, was just that personal. and then i got the chit. blow it off. 3 sides to every story. years from you won't remember or care.
